project1.title: Gear Stock
project1.description: Gear Stock is a way for musicians to manage and track the gear, or musical instruments, that they own. Musicians need an app where they can quickly go to see what they have to sell, lend out, its condition, warranty terms, when and where they got it, its value, and does it need to go.
project1.technologiesUsed: HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Bootstrap 4, React, Recharts, React Search Field, Firebase

project2.title: Just Do It
project2.description: The To Do Application served as an introduction to the four basic functions of persistent storage: create, read, update and delete (CRUD). Axios was used to make HTTP requests and Google's Firebase acted as a persistent realtime database in the cloud.
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Firebase, Webpack, Bootstrap

project3.title: HalfTime
project3.description: HalfTime is an application for band directors and volunteers to manage and track the programâ€™s students, instruments, uniforms and events. This application is currently in progress and will updated when completed.
project3.technologiesUsed: HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Twilio, Bootstrap 4, React, Recharts, React Search Field, Firebase

project4.title: Developer Portal
project4.description: Developer Portal is a way to gauge your progress as a software developer and keep track of resources you are interested in.

project5.title: Parting Pets
project5.description: Here lies our knowledge of Javascript in a nutshell! We demonstrate our knowledge of Axios REST API calls, Firebase, JQuery, vanilla JavaScript, Bootstrap, and SASS
project5.technologiesUsed: HTML5, SASS, Firebase, Bootstrap, JQuery, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
